author: ncsyannex
content: Quick question: what would happen to the ethereum network if hypothetically ALL archive nodes crashed at the same time for an extended period of time ( let's say 1 week ) ?

author: pietjepuk
content: then someone would sync up a new archive node for those few questions/queries they need it for

author: ncsyannex
content: But archive nodes are not required for the safety of the network ? We would just not have access to historical data ?

author: pietjepuk
content: Without archive nodes you still have all historical data, but you just don't have readily available access to historical state

author: pietjepuk
content:
Note that EIP-4444 [0] proposes to remove this historical data availability requirement from the clients' p2p layer. Of course historical data can still be made available and/or imported by other means (outside of the devp2p/libp2p network for short-term historical data). See also the current discussion in <#745077610685661265> 

[0] https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4444

author: ncsyannex
content: Thanks a lot for the info

author: pietjepuk
content: Note that this Eth R&D server aims to promote discussion on core protocol development, and tries to avoid creating too much room for "beginner" questions to keep things focused (see also the <#745072678079168654> message). See https://ethereum.org/en/community/online/ for a list of online resources and other Discord servers if you have any follow-up questions üôÇ
